ibis.ipl
Class IbisStarter

java.lang.Object
  ibis.ipl.IbisStarter

public abstract class IbisStarter
extends Object

Every Ibis implementation must provide an IbisStarter which is used by the Ibis factory to check capabilities, port types, and to start an Ibis instance. This class is not to be used by Ibis applications. Ibis applications should use IbisFactory to create Ibis instances.

Method Detail

createInstance

public static IbisStarter createInstance(String className,
                                         ClassLoader classLoader,
                                         String nickName,
                                         String iplVersion,
                                         String implementationVersion)
Creates a starter of a given class using reflection. Returns null if this fails for any reason.

Parameters:
className - the name of the class to instantiate. Must extend IbisStarter.
classLoader - the class loader to use.
nickName - the nickname of the ibis starter.
iplVersion - the IPL version this ibis implements.
implementationVersion - the version of this ibis.
Returns:
an IbisStarter instance for the given class name.

getNickName

public String getNickName()
Short name of this implementation. Usually the network stack it is based on, e.g. "tcp" or "mpi".

Returns:
the nickName.

getIplVersion

public String getIplVersion()
Which version of the IPL does this implementation implement.

Returns:
the IPL version.

getImplementationVersion

public String getImplementationVersion()
Version identifier of this implementation. Usually a checksum created from the class files of the implementation.

Returns:
the implementation version.

toString

public String toString()
Returns a short name of this implementation.

Overrides:
toString in class Object
Returns:
a short name.

matches

public abstract boolean matches(IbisCapabilities capabilities,
                                PortType[] portTypes)
Decides if this IbisStarter can start an Ibis instance with the desired capabilities and port types.

Parameters:
capabilities - the desired capabilities.
portTypes - the desired port types.
Returns:
true if it can.

unmatchedIbisCapabilities

public abstract CapabilitySet unmatchedIbisCapabilities(IbisCapabilities capabilities,
                                                        PortType[] portTypes)
Returns the required capabilities that are not matched by this starter. Note: a stacking Ibis returns the capabilities that are required of the underlying Ibis implementation.

Returns:
the unmatched ibis capabilities.

unmatchedPortTypes

public abstract PortType[] unmatchedPortTypes(IbisCapabilities capabilities,
                                              PortType[] portTypes)
Returns the list of port types that are not matched by this starter. If all required port types match, this method returns an array with 0 elements. Note: a stacking Ibis returns the port types that are required of the underlying Ibis implementation.

Returns:
the unmatched port types.

startIbis

public abstract Ibis startIbis(IbisFactory factory,
                               RegistryEventHandler handler,
                               Properties userProperties,
                               IbisCapabilities capabilities,
                               Credentials credentials,
                               byte[] applicationTag,
                               PortType[] portTypes,
                               String specifiedSubImplementation)
                        throws IbisCreationFailedException
Actually creates an Ibis instance from this starter.

Parameters:
factory - the factory starting this Ibis instance.
handler - a registry event handler.
userProperties - the user properties.
capabilities - the required capabilities.
credentials - credentials offered by a user when it wants to join a pool.
applicationTag - an application level tag for this Ibis instance.
portTypes - the required port types.
specifiedSubImplementation - for stacking ibis starters, the name of the underlying Ibis implementation.
Throws:
IbisCreationFailedException
